content.question: Which of the following best identifies a benefit of using renewable energy sources rather than nonrenewable energy sources?

choices.label: Renewable energy sources do not have negative environmental impacts, whereas nonrenewable energy sources have many negative environmental impacts.
Renewable energy sources are replenishable and are virtually inexhaustible by human consumption, whereas nonrenewable sources do not form in a short period of time.
Renewable energy sources are available uniformly throughout the world, whereas nonrenewable sources are unequally distributed.
Renewable energy technologies are more developed and more readily available than nonrenewable energy technologies.

content.answer: Renewable energy sources are replenishable and are virtually inexhaustible by human consumption, whereas nonrenewable sources do not form in a short period of time.
